New Records: Corey Seager became the first player in World Series history to hit two two-run home runs in a single game; Texas Rangers extended their postseason winning streak to nine with a 3-1 victory; Arizona Diamondbacks' Ketel Marte extended his postseason hitting streak to 19 games
Key Match Events: Corey Seager's two-run home runs in the third and ninth innings; Texas Rangers' pitching staff limited Arizona Diamondbacks' offense; Arizona Diamondbacks' only run came in the eighth inning with an RBI single by Geraldo Perdomo; Max Scherzer departed with back tightness after three innings; Adolis Garcia made a game-saving play at the plate
Pre-Game Insights: The game was the third of a seven-game World Series; Texas Rangers were unbeaten away from home entering the series; Corey Seager's performance was a key factor in the Rangers' success
Post-Match Reflections: Texas Rangers took a 2-1 series lead; Arizona Diamondbacks' offense struggled against Texas Rangers' pitching; Max Scherzer's injury was a concern for the Diamondbacks
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game was played on October 31, 2023; The series shifted to Arizona for Game Four
